job_title: Home Care Physical Therapist in Concord, MA
pros: Relatively laid back supervisor/manager/office staff make for easy communication and smooth patient care/scheduling. I feel the clinican's voices are heard in terms of patient advocacy. They still push sometimes for extending into 2nd period, decreasing total visits, etc, but will not force you to change visit frequency or question your clinical decision making.
cons: Low pay for the home care field

pros: The best part about Emerson Hospital by far was the sense of community, which largely contrasted the cold, uninviting hospitals I had worked for in the past. People genuinely liked each other and went out of their way to help as much as they could, even when they already had a lot on their own plates.
cons: As someone who spent most of my life in places that never get any snow, I didn’t realize how much the cold winters would affect me. If Emerson was in a warmer climate, I would still be there to this day.

pros: I liked the people, my coworkers, they are great! We had great time at outings and enjoyed pot luck lunches!!
cons: Too many requirements and the pay is low. Not good. They treat us like we are at school or even worse. Every trip to the bathroom- you have to explain why it took you so long, etc.

pros:
-Tight knit team and a strong sense of community. Everyone genuinely enjoys taking care of patients and we come together to give them the best quality of care possible. 

-The schedule is good. I have never needed to work unreasonable hours.

-Management is communicative and they try to accommodate to our needs as best as they can.
cons: Doesn’t pay as much as a large hospital. Personally, I’m happy to take a small pay cut if that means working in a better environment, but I know everyone has different preferences.

pros: Decent first job out of college, not much room for growth though
cons: The benefits are pretty average

job_title: Patient Service Representative in Concord, MA
pros: A very caring and involved organization. I liked that the managers didn’t hover over us. They were easy to talk to whenever I had questions, though.
cons: Wasn’t my favorite job in the world, especially when some of the patients were rude.

pros: So far, I’m impressed with Emerson Hospital! Leadership has been incredibly supportive as I’ve been settling in, and my new coworkers don’t mind taking time to show me the ropes. I’m excited to see where this job takes me!
cons: Genuinely can’t think of anything to write here, and that’s saying something!

cons: On the flipside, it can be challenging if you aren’t used to a faster pace.

pros: Great teamwork and competitive pay. Facilities are kept clean. Management is understanding when something personal comes up last minute.

pros: There is nothing good about this place.

They take advantage of you and at the end of the day you are exhausted. You can't even take your break right to be called to clean up something ON your break. This place is a joke.

job_title: Marketing Technology Manager in Concord, MA
pros: A community feel and friendly people.
cons: I can't think of any cons

review_title: Truly is the Best Place to Come for Care & Work
pros: The work environment is so positive! Whether you're passing a nurse in the hall, a Sr. Leader, physician, volunteer or cafe worker, everyone gets a friendly acknowledgement. I've always felt so welcomed at Emerson in the four years that I have been employed. The CEO hosts many employee appreciation events, town hall meetings and luncheons so that all of the staff can be informed on the latest hospital news which is very important to the success of the hospital. We are never left in the dark here and that is what I enjoy most about this hospital. If the CEO has news, she will be honest and upfront right away. Her open door policy is appreciated, as I am a nurse here at the hospital and cannot always make luncheons or town hall meetings, so I feel welcome to stop by her office anytime and ask her what I missed or send her an email.
cons: I haven't been faced with any cons during the four years that I have been employed here. Emerson is all about being a team!

job_title: Nutrition Assistant in West Concord, MA
pros: Emerson Hospital has a positive environment, incentives, moral boosts, friendly co-workers and management, awesome community outreach, good food
cons: Not too much room for growth in my dept (nutrition), parking off site, never got promotion, pay rate, people (patients) from Concord can be difficult (snobby). Training was somewhat of a disaster. People would do their jobs consistently wrong and there were no repercussions.

pros: Emerson is a great community hospital. Having been an employee here for 3 years, and also being admitted onto the floor due to an unexpected illness, the patient care and friendly staff is what impressed me. The staff were diligent and friendly to me throughout my visit. I also noticed the interaction amongst co-workers and it seemed to reflect that of a great camaraderie.
cons: I work at one of the off-site locations, so I don't always get to make it to Emerson events that are held at the main campus.

job_title: Patient Care Technician in Concord, MA
pros: Everyone who walks through the halls is kind and compassionate. Come visit and walk through the halls to see for yourself! They way your treated in the hallway, is the same way you're treated on the floors as a patient. Patients are truly #1 here at Emerson. When it's busy, our manager buys us pizza or cookies. I know it's a small thing, but it means a lot. Management recognizes when the staff need a boost. I've worked in a few other local hospitals and I've never been happier then being here at Emerson.
cons: When I came in for my interview, I rode in a very old elevator that was a bit scary.

pros:
Excellent facility. My work space was recently updated and is modern and fresh.
Opportunities to get certified in my specialty.
Outstanding Cafeteria-- food is delicious with a varied menu, healthy choices and well-priced.
Senior management really cares about the staff.  A colleague in my department passed away and the CEO and the VPs actually brought in lunch and helped us to celebrate our friend's life. The spent a lot of time with us and you could tell they really cared how we were doing. It felt like being with my family.  I have not experienced this in any other work setting.
cons:
We have had some turnover in our manager -- mostly for personal reasons--but that can be unsettling.
You don't get immediate access to the parking garage until you have been there a whil.

review_title: Started Good but fell apart fast.
job_title: Mental Health Counselor in Concord, MA
pros: Fair pay, Paid Time off, Benefits Package, Sick Time, Professional Colleagues.
cons: Terrible Management, Poor Communication, Poor/Hostile Work Environment, no growth at all. Management was bad, Assistant Manager would call out every week and have weekends off, when there was an issue at all management made you fix it, even if they started the problem (problem can sometimes be a violent patient).  Overworked, counselors and nurses would be constantly overworked and overburdened especially on 2nd shift, when the evening staff showed up at the door there were 2 or 3 admissions waiting almost every day. CEO gets paid a lot and her lackeys get too much also, all they do is go to meetings and leave.

pros: My co-workers and I truly believe Emerson is the best place to come for care and work. The staff, management and Sr. leaders all work well together and I believe that I am always kept in the loop about the hospital, by attending monthly meetings and lunches with the CEO. It's a great opportunity to stay involved. As a 10 year employee, I am always interested to learn more.
cons: The OR has been so busy and it's hard when I'm trying to leave the floor for the day, but I end up working later hours than expected. Hard to adjust my schedule at home at times.

pros: I work with some terrific people at Emerson. Everyone is extremely dedicated to their work and really helps each other out. We are a relatively new and growing department. It is excited to be part of this vibrant organization. My boss is great and she loves the people she works for, too. That makes it good for all of us.
cons: The billing department is about 3 minutes from the hospital so sometimes I have to travel there to meet with the physician staff support.

pros: This is a great place to work! The people in my department and throughout the hospital are very friendly. People help each other out which is nice to see...I was here one month and I got invited to lunch with the President of the Hospital. She is a nurse so she understands how it all works. The cafeteria is excellent and is discounted for employees. The have an terrific gift shop, too!  They run sales for the staff which is nice.
cons: I can't think of anything specific at this time because this is so much better than my last hospital job....maybe make the cafeteria a bit bigger... put the drinks all in one area...

pros: It is always good to work for a hospital that is growing, Emerson is consistently recruiting new physicians and opening new locations.  Our long term manager just recently left and the senior management took the time to hire the right person, even the staff got to interview all the candidates.  They have excellent benefits and fun employee activities throughout the year.  Nice mix of new staff and long term employees.  By far the best place I have ever worked in healthcare.
cons: Out department could use a facelift, many other areas of the hospital have been updated so hopefully it is on the list.

pros:
Emerson Hospital is a community hospital that takes pride in services it provides to its patients in both an outpatient and inpatient setting. 
The hospital strives to provide a positive experience to staff and patients through a team approach working with staff, patients and the community.
The hospital provides big hospital services in a small community setting, working with the most competent physicians, support and clinical teams; all working collaboratively to provide quality  patient care.

Provides opportunities for growth both professionally and financially
cons: Because of the staffing ratios, overtime is difficult to receive.

job_title: Patient Care Technician in Concord, MA
pros: Great co-workers and easy commute
cons: Equipment is outdated, computer system is archaic, never know who to contact with issues

review_title: Best Place I have Ever Worked
pros: Emerson by far is the best place I have ever worked.  From Senior Management  to my direct supervisor everyone wants to make sure it is a great place for people to work.  We are given the staff to make sure we take care of the patients everyday.  The doctors in my office are amazing and I would not hesitate to have them care for any of my friends or family.
cons: Have to ride a shuttle to park across the street.

job_title: Patient Account Specialist in Concord, MA
pros: This used to be a great place to work, they really cared about their employees, I was there for 11 years
cons: Change in management, went from a caring manager with 25 years experience and replaced her with a fresh face out of college with too much ambition and no people skills. Now they are micromanaging to push people out with the ultimate goal of a partners merger.

review_title: Stone Age, over worked, under staffed
pros: Pay is fair- does not out weight the cons though
cons:
Horrible Benefits 
Bad management with little to no power over staff 
No breaks, pay taken
Bad differentials 
No grow potential 
Zero incentive 
No raises. You will get the same yearly cost of living raise as the person sitting next to you, that may do far less
Voice will never be heard
All about making money instead of fair patient care
“Everyone is replaceable“ motto
Technology is old and is constantly breaking down

review_title: A Very Special Place to Work!
pros:
Everyone is friendly
The place is clean and is always renovating different areas of the hospital
Interesting work and chance to professional and personally develop
Good access to management who listens to your ideas
Health and wellness class with employee discount
on-site program like weightwatchers
cons: health care is undergoing major changes...the hospital has to make changes and sometimes change is hard for people to accept...

review_title: Do what you say NOT what you do!
pros: Nice People and plenty of Projects
cons:
Senior Managment has no direction nor  how to engage employees. .
They think they do by having mandatory engagment seminars but they fail to execute.
No accountability ...mangers love pointing fingers and degrade employees if not within click.
Use of unethical practices are in play..they just have not been caught yet!!
Employees scared to talk for they may get fired..CEO blind to the real problem within her own Leadership Team. CFO who thinks he is a CIO has failed and is a joke to the organization. He throughs money to bandaid real problem. 
Very Sad..Used to be a real great place to work.

review_title: Hospital has great vision but high turn over
pros: I like the vision and values of the hospital. They try to be progressive and inclusive as much as they can and they pay well.
cons: The nurse and social work turn over is very high because the job is hard work with not a lot of training or support because everyone else is spread thin too.

pros:
Great IT team and cutting edge technology  used by Emerson Hospital for better patient care, super vision and direction by CIO
Plenty of new project/work opportunities within individual IT group, you have to be self-motivated to take on new task and run with it.
cons: Lots of work,  so work/Life balance should be kept in mind

review_title: Great people, great place to work!"

Nice atmosphere

Great colleagues! Love my team.

pros: The managers are very flexible with your work hours. I have been supported with my schedule as I juggle little kids and again parents.  The pay and benefits are very good.
